duties_responsibilities.duty: Research innovative learning delivery methods and develop content for professional audiences, individuals, and families within the Autism community.
Lead training program design, development, implementation, and evaluation aligned with adult learning theory and core values.
Manage Autism Society's Learning Management System (LMS) and online training, including user permissions, administrative access, and quality assurance.
Develop and maintain training certification and accreditation, establish communities of practice, and manage training calendar and announcements.
Partner with Subject Matter Experts to develop supplemental teaching resources and support marketing efforts for programmatic assets.
Facilitate collaboration among culturally diverse teams, stakeholders, and program constituents to support a given program.
Lead meetings with experts, address feedback, and collaborate with third-party consultants and collaborators to support funding projects.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in education, social work, psychology, non-profit, or related field (required). Master’s degree in leadership, project management, organizational development, business, non-profit or related field (preferred)
